title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 629.3 - Classifications of JOBS reimbursement claiming
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 629.3 - Classifications of JOBS reimbursement claiming

State Regulations
(a) Reimbursement may be claimed pursuant to
this Part for JOBS training program activities and related supportive services
that are described in Part 385 of this Title. (b) Administrative expenditures for
employment and training activities offered pursuant to Part 385 of this Title
may include, but are not limited to, the activities described below: (1)
orientation/notification:; (2)
preparation of assessment/employability
plans; (3)
education; (4)
post-secondary education; (5)
job skills training; (6)
job readiness training; (7)
job development/job placement; (8)
group/individual job search; (9)
work experience; (10)
work supplementation; (11)
on-the-job training; (12)
case management; (13)
referral to the job service; and
(14)
other activities described
in department directions set forth in section
600.2
(g) of this

Title. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18
ยง
629.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
